Author: Apathetic_Proton
Text: I take some medications that have weight loss and lack of appetite as a possible side effect. I wouldn't be able to randomly quit them without being in a world of pain. My doctor would also most likely be unamused if my parents withheld my prescribed medications.   Would it be possible to hide your medications, either in your parents' house or at your boyfriend's house? That way you can continue taking your medications.   Another thing to keep in mind: "No." is a complete sentence, and it's something you can tell your family during situations that make you uncomfortable. :) I hope the next month is as stress free as possible for you! Stay safe!

Author: tigerchik
Text: A lot of it is definitely water weight.  It's dangerous to not be taking prescribed meds - you could have major side effects from "quitting" them cold turkey. Call a pharmacist or the prescribing doctor and have them talk to your parents. Not letting you take them is BAD PARENTING.  stomach rumbling is not necessarily indicating hunger. It can be from digestion.  can you work with a dietician, who would NOT be on board with soda and kool aid all the time?
